Hey, I tried searching this and I couldn\'t really figure out an answer (but if there is another thread feel free to insult me).

Is there any button responsible for applying brakes with landing gear? I landed my shuttle on a random patch of land on Kerbin, but it just rolled uncontrollably and took forever to decelerate. If this is a common issue that will be dealt with later, I understand, but I want to make sure im not missing anything. To circumvent this, I tried to attach some RCS and thrust backwards after landing, but it seems to really destabilize the plane. Any help would be appreciated ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
'B' is the default brake on the landing gear.

The brake as stated above, but another good idea is to put parachutes on the back of your space plane to slow it down Shuttle-style ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

OR!

you can use retro rockets for...

KERBAL STYLE!
Awesome, thanks everyone for all the ideas, and thanks for the clarifications on the controls Feragorn ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
